text:
Stephanie records some of the running times for members of her team. Each runner runs at a constant speed. She uses

  • positive numbers for running speeds to the right and for time in the future and
  • negative numbers for running speeds to the left and for times in the past.
Hahn passes the 0 meter mark running 5 meters per second to the right. Where will he be 6 seconds later?
Aurelia passes the 0 meter mark running to the left at 6 meters per second. Where will she be 8 seconds later?
Dwayne passes the 0 meter mark running 4 meters per second to the right. Where was he 6 seconds earlier?
Tori passes the 0 meter mark running to the left at 5 meters per second. Where was she 7 seconds earlier?

For each person on the team, do the following:

  • Write and solve an equation that represents their action.
  • Determine whether the answer is to the left or to the right of 0.

These are possible answers. Students might use repeated addition sentences other than those presented, but the multiplication sentence should reflect the problem parameters.

Hahn: 5+5+5+5+5+5 = 30 meter point or 6•5 = 30 meter point. This is to the right of 0.

Aurelia: -6 + (-6) + (-6) + (-6) + (-6) + (-6) + (-6) + (-6) = -48 meter point or 8•(-6) = -48 meter point. This is to the left of 0.

Dwayne is running to the right. To find his location 6 seconds earlier, we move left.

0 – 4 - 4 - 4 - 4 - 4 - 4 = -24 meter point or -4 + (-4) + (-4) + (-4) + (-4) + (-4) = -24 meter point or 6•(-4) = -24 meter point. This is to the left of 0.

Tori is running to the left. To find her location 7 seconds earlier, we move right. 0 – (-5) – (-5) – (-5) – (-5) – (-5) – (-5) – (-5) = 35 meter point of 5+5+5+5+5+5+5 = 35 meter point or -7•(-5) = 35 meter point. This is to the right of 0.
